highlights.text: Linux 6.12 introduced Landlock scope flags to restrict abstract UNIX sockets and cross-domain signal delivery, tightening IPC for sandboxed processes.
Linux 6.15 added audit logging for Landlock denials plus new logging policy flags, enabling operators to debug sandbox escapes and tune policies.
The Rust landlock crate gained support for the latest ABI alongside guidance for new user-space adopters such as Nomad and GNOME tracker-extract.
Youki v0.5.4 (July 2025) added exec CPU affinity controls and improved mount handling, strengthening container resource isolation on cgroups v2.
Recent releases fixed Wasm executor shutdown behavior and UID/GID mapping tests, showing active hardening of non-Linux guest workloads inside Youki.
Wasmtime 28.0.0 introduced a signals-based-traps feature flag and reduced guard regions, letting hosts choose trap enforcement while porting to new OSes.
Wasmtime 31.0.0 (March 2025) continued stack-switching work and completed Winch SIMD support, improving multi-threaded sandbox scheduling and performance.
Firecracker 1.13.0 (2024) added optional PCI device support and diff snapshots without dirty tracking, expanding microVM isolation scenarios while keeping lightweight security boundaries.
